definition: to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: This gold-plated copper commemorative medallion has a diameter of 50mm.
sentences.chinese: 此枚纪念章为铜质镀金，直径50毫米。

sentences.english: A new pin design is to be released every day for the next 17 days.
sentences.chinese: 在接下来的17天里，每天发行一款新的纪念章。

sentences.english: The entire set of medallions is furnished with an organic glass plate.
sentences.chinese: 整套纪念章以有机玻璃牌进行装祯。

sentences.english: They will strike a medal in memory of the great victory.
sentences.chinese: 他们将冲制一枚纪念章纪念这场伟大的胜利。

sentences.english: This medallion is made of gold-plated copper with a diameter of 50mm.
sentences.chinese: 此枚纪念章为铜质镀金，规格直径50毫米。

sentences.english: This Medallion is made of gold-plated copper with a diameter of 50mm.
sentences.chinese: 此枚纪念章为铜质镀金，直径50毫米。

sentences.english: By the sculpture, you can print some more cute commemorative stampers.
sentences.chinese: 在雕塑边，你可以加盖许多可爱的纪念章。

sentences.english: They'll strike a medal in memory of the great victory.
sentences.chinese: 他们将为纪念这一伟大的胜利铸造一枚纪念章。

sentences.english: But up to now has not received the task of issuing medals.
sentences.chinese: 但到现在没有接到发行纪念章的任务。

sentences.english: This Commemorative Medallion is made of gold-plated copper with a diameter of 50mm.
sentences.chinese: 此枚纪念章为铜质镀金，直径50毫米。

sentences.english: The bottom of the metal is made of black crystal and metals.
sentences.chinese: 纪念章底座用黑水晶及金属搭建。

sentences.english: This set includes 5 gold-plated copper medallions , each with a diameter of 40mm.
sentences.chinese: 此套纪念章为铜质镀金，直径40毫米，共5枚。

sentences.english: The first design released is that of a Coca Cola bottle cap.
sentences.chinese: 发行的第一款纪念章为可乐瓶的“瓶盖”。

sentences.english: A commemorative medal was struck in honour of the event.
sentences.chinese: 为纪念这次活动铸造了一枚纪念章。

definition: items issued by a postal service and collected by philatelists (stamps, postcards, first day covers etc)
